classData.comment:
/**
 * @summary Defines a sorting rule for data collections, determining the order of items based on a property or custom function.
 *
 * `Neo.collection.Sorter` encapsulates a single sort criteria (e.g., `property: 'name', direction: 'ASC'`).
 * Collections (like `Neo.data.Store`) use arrays of these Sorter instances to perform multi-level sorting.
 *
 * **Key Features:**
 * - **Reactivity:** Changes to `property` or `direction` configs automatically fire a `change` event, prompting the parent collection to re-sort.
 * - **Value Transformation:** The `useTransformValue` config allows values to be normalized before comparison (e.g., lowercasing strings for case-insensitive sorting).
 * - **Custom Sorting:** The `sortBy` config allows providing a fully custom comparison function, overriding the default property-based logic.
 * - **Null Handling:** `null` and `undefined` values are always pushed to the bottom of the sorted results, regardless of the sort direction (`ASC` or `DESC`), ensuring stable transitivity and predictable UI rendering.
 *
 * @class Neo.collection.Sorter
 * @extends Neo.core.Base
 * @mixes Neo.core.Observable
 * @see Neo.collection.Base
 * @see Neo.data.Store
 */
classData.summary:
Defines a sorting rule for data collections, determining the order of items based on a property or custom function.

`Neo.collection.Sorter` encapsulates a single sort criteria (e.g., `property: 'name', direction: 'ASC'`).
Collections (like `Neo.data.Store`) use arrays of these Sorter instances to perform multi-level sorting.

**Key Features:**
- **Reactivity:** Changes to `property` or `direction` configs automatically fire a `change` event, prompting the parent collection to re-sort.
- **Value Transformation:** The `useTransformValue` config allows values to be normalized before comparison (e.g., lowercasing strings for case-insensitive sorting).
- **Custom Sorting:** The `sortBy` config allows providing a fully custom comparison function, overriding the default property-based logic.
- **Null Handling:** `null` and `undefined` values are always pushed to the bottom of the sorted results, regardless of the sort direction (`ASC` or `DESC`), ensuring stable transitivity and predictable UI rendering.
classData.name: Sorter

classData.comment:
/**
     * True automatically applies the core.Observable mixin
     * @member {Boolean} observable=true
     * @static
     */
classData.name: observable

classData.comment:
/**
         * Internal config which maps the direction ASC to 1, -1 otherwise
         * @member {Number} directionMultiplier=1
         * @protected
         */
classData.description: Internal config which maps the direction ASC to 1, -1 otherwise
classData.name: directionMultiplier

classData.comment:
/**
         * The sort direction when using a property.
         * @member {String} direction_='ASC'
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description: The sort direction when using a property.
classData.name: direction_

classData.comment:
/**
         * The owner util.Collection needs to apply an onChange listener once
         * @member {boolean} listenerApplied=false
         * @protected
         */
classData.description: The owner util.Collection needs to apply an onChange listener once
classData.name: listenerApplied

classData.comment:
/**
         * The property to sort by.
         * @member {String} property_='id'
         * @reactive
         */
classData.name: property_

classData.comment:
/**
         * Provide a custom sorting function, has a higher priority than property & direction
         * @member {Function|null} sortBy=null
         * @see https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Collator
         */
classData.description: Provide a custom sorting function, has a higher priority than property & direction
classData.name: sortBy

classData.comment:
/**
         * True to use the transformValue method for each item (the method can get overridden)
         * @member {Boolean} useTransformValue=true
         * @protected
         */
classData.description: True to use the transformValue method for each item (the method can get overridden)
classData.name: useTransformValue

classData.comment:
/**
     * Default sorter function which gets used by collections in case at least one sorter has a real sortBy method
     * @param a
     * @param b
     */
classData.description: Default sorter function which gets used by collections in case at least one sorter has a real sortBy method
classData.name: defaultSortBy

classData.description: Serializes the instance into a JSON-compatible object for the Neural Link.
classData.name: toJSON
